ica.sugarwars.enemies

Class EnergydrinkEnemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.GameObject
      • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.MoveableGameObject
        • ica.sugarwars.CollidableGameObject
          • ica.sugarwars.Entity
            • ica.sugarwars.Enemy
              • ica.sugarwars.enemies.EnergydrinkEnemy

  • public class EnergydrinkEnemy
extends Enemy
    Author:
    Stefan Mudde Lots of health, low speed en very high impact damage. If shot down player gets 150 health back.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void collisionOccurred(CollidableGameObject collidingObj)
      If an enemy hits an other CollidableGameObject like a Player, it might interact Here is the interaction between enemy and Player handled The player will suffer damage and the enemy will die
      void onDie()
      If this enemy runs out of health, the enemy dies A score is also added to the current score Adds an healthbonus to the player

      • onDie

        public void onDie()
        If this enemy runs out of health, the enemy dies A score is also added to the current score Adds an healthbonus to the player
        Overrides:
        onDie in class Enemy

      • collisionOccurred

        public void collisionOccurred(CollidableGameObject collidingObj)
        Description copied from class: Enemy
        If an enemy hits an other CollidableGameObject like a Player, it might interact Here is the interaction between enemy and Player handled The player will suffer damage and the enemy will die
        Overrides:
        collisionOccurred in class Enemy
        Parameters:
        collidingObj - The colliding object. If the player destroys the energydrink, a healthboost is applied. But the same function is called if the energydrink collides with the player To stop a player from gaining health after collision, we implented collisionOccurred in override without onDie to prevent this from happening
